item.title: Cloning virtual machines in vSphere series – Part 3: Linked Clones
item.description: Let’s start with part 3 in the cloning virtual machines in vSphere series, I am going to talk about another type of clones, linked clones! All articles regarding cloning virtual machines in vSphere series: Part 1: Types of clone Part 2: Full Clone Part 4: Instant Clones (not published yet) As said in previous articles, this series is only focused on VMware vSphere hence, VMware Horizon View is not contemplated (Linked clones are commonly used in that product).

item.title: Cloning virtual machines in vSphere series – Part 2: Full clone
item.description: Continuing with the cloning virtual machines in vSphere series, today I am going to write about the full clone, how it works and some useful information about it. So, let’s talk about clones… but just full clones. How does it work? As you probably know a full clone is an exact copy of a source VM, meaning that, everything from the parent VM is copied (VM settings, disks, files, etc.).
